Josh, since I believe you are using Jason Gauci's code, I think he probably=
 has the best idea how that could be done through his code.  However, I bel=
ieve Jason is traveling and offline until Monday or so, so I would guess he=
 can offer useful advice after that.

It does sound like what you are askin=
g should be fairly straightforward.  Is it not possible to simply loop thro=
ugh the fitnesses, set them all to zero, and then call the evaluation loop =
again?

ken

--- In neat@yahoogroups.com, Joshua Auerbach <joshua.auerbach@=
...> wrote:
>
> I have a question for any of you that know the HyperNEAT co=
de.  
> Basically I am trying to incorporate changing environmental conditi=
ons 
> into my algorithm such that when a certain criteria is met the 
> en=
vironment I evaluate my evolved neural networks in is modified.  When 
> th=
is happens I  want to throw out the fitness of all the individuals in 
> my=
 population that were obtained from the old environment and force them 
> t=
o be reevaluated in the new environment.  Does anyone have a suggestion 
> =
for how this can be done?
> 
> Thanks,
> Josh
>
